thanks alex, 

i'm new in neat. if I use the NEAT for classification, what =
the first things i 
must to do?

best regards
eko sakti, 

________________=
________________
Dari: Alexandre Devert <marmakoide@...>
Kepada: neat@=
yahoogroups.com
Terkirim: Rab, 6 April, 2011 23:01:48
Judul: Re : [neat] as=
k about NEAT

  
Hi,

NEAT optimize neural network. NEAT will generate many=
 neural network, and you 
give a *fitness* to each neural network. Higher f=
itness means more interesting 
neural network.

Thus, with NEAT, you can pr=
oduce neural networks that can themselves can be used 
for doing classifica=
tion. Your fitness for a given neural network should be its 
classification=
 performance. To avoid over-learning (a classifier which does not 
generali=
ze), be careful to not use the same sample set to compute classification 
p=
erformance.

Also, be sure that more classic machine learning methods are n=
ot suitable, like 
SVM or back-prop, they are likely to be faster if they w=
ork good enough on your 
problem. Those methods are less general than NEAT =
but can exploit some 
properties specific to supervised learning for speed =
gain.

Alex

p>Hi,<br>
<br>
NEAT optimize neural network. NEAT will generate many neural=
 network, and you give a *fitness* to each neural network. Higher fitness m=
eans more interesting neural network.<br>
<br>
Thus, with NEAT, you can pro=
duce neural networks that can themselves can be used for doing classificati=
on. Your fitness for a given neural network should be its classification pe=
rformance. To avoid over-learning (a classifier which does not generalize),=
 be careful to not use the same sample set to compute classification perfor=
mance.<br>
<br>
Also, be sure that more classic machine learning methods ar=
e not suitable, like SVM or back-prop, they are likely to be faster if they=
 work good enough on your problem. Those methods are less general than NEAT=
 but can exploit some properties specific to supervised learning for speed =
gain.<br>
<br>
Alex<br>
<br>
